Reviews.Title: “Warm, comfortable suite and exceptionally clean.”
Reviews.Author: auklazer
Reviews.Content: The strangest thing I've seen at a hotel in a long time going into their lobby. I'm a road warrior so hence, I've got my head down (not looking around for anything exciting like ambiance), tugging a piece of luggage with both hands into the front of the hotel. The double front doors automatically open, as they should, when I'm not even paying any attention to them. I enter a brief anti-lobby then another set of doors; or should I say, a single pull door not even wide enough to pull the luggage through. So I've got to drop the luggage, swing the door, and push one piece through at a time into the hotel lobby. I've not seen this poor a piece of engineering since the Yugo. Otherwise, nice staff, beautifully clean suite, nice office chair at the living room table, but they certainly are missing the boat with the extremely over-sized behemoth of an antiquated analog television.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: momfitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three weeks while a family member was receiving medical treatment at IU. The room was very clean, spacious, and comfortable. The staff was wonderful. They were friendly, helpful, and went out of their way to be sure that our needs were met. The building and all of the facilities are extremely well maintained. There is some construction going on immediately around the hotel, so the area is not very scenic. There are partially built buildings with cranes and large dirt mounds, so it may not have a great first impression. However, there is no construction noise. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel near downtown”
Reviews.Author: RahulMD
Reviews.Content: Dwcent all suites hotel near downtown. Pretty much on the edge of the ghetto section of town. I stayed here since they have a free shuttle to the medical center and will take you anywhere within in 5 miles of the hotel. The place was safe, clean and would def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca_Cooper
Reviews.Content: I've been taking my dad to Indy for cancer treatments, and this hotel is convenient, roomy, comfortable, and the people are friendly. Everything you need after a stressful day at the medical center.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE FRONT DESK”
Reviews.Author: jamesanthony77
Reviews.Content: Bad hotel management. had concerns and requested to see manager. never did. hotel had bed bugs. shuttle service get upset if they have to go further than 1 mile from hotel.(only go to hospital and downtown) unfriendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious place to stay, close to downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: Stepheknee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while touring with my company. The rooms are the size of apartments with full kitchens and lots of closet space. Laundry facilities are free. There's a gym and small store by the front desk. The hotel is not too close to anything, so it would be more convinient to have a car. The shuttle is a good way to grab groceries at a local supermarket or go downtown. Overall a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for families”
Reviews.Author: bradsgirl
Reviews.Content: Candlewood Suites I picked this hotel for several reasons one being they offered packages to the zoo and Children’s museum that saved us a lot of money. They are just about a mile from the zoo. All though the location is a little odd the price was great. The hotel rooms themselves were amazing. We travel with a two year old that goes to bed early so we prefer suites whenever possible. I booked a one bedroom but was upgraded to a two bedroom which was perfect. This was a former apartment building so they are set up with a long hallway with the bedrooms and bathroom off of that. The kitchen was perfect and enabled us to save money by cooking both nights of our stay. My husband appreciated the recliner in the living room. My son loved having his own room in a hotel. The area is mostly hospitals and the IUPUI campus so a lot of students and people staying while their family is in the hospital. We also saw a lot of football fans staying there due to the close proximity to the Colts stadium. It seemed very safe and there was a fence that surrounded the entire property. We did not go down and check out the pool area since it is outdoors and it was way to cold for that. There also was a playground area down there but the weather was not right for that either. The room was very clean as were the hallways and lobby. The little grocery area was well stocked but a little expensive but nice if you needed something quick. They offered free DVD’s to go with the DVD player in the room. Not a big choice but a nice touch. The staff was all very helpful and friendly. The free wifi worked great except for the morning that they had changed the password and I didn’t know it. A quick trip to the desk and I was back online. The kitchen provided paper towels, free coffee, and tea bags. Our stay was great and we hope to stay there again in the spring. I will note they were having a lot of issues with one of the elevators but they were working to fix it most of the time we were there. Since there were two that was not an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Josh T
Reviews.Content: My stay was fantastic!! Staff was great nice oversized clean room. Came in town for a convention and wouldnt stay or recommend anywhere else. Wish I would of brought the family and actually used the room.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: TinaCollins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Indianapolis MotoGP Race - The location of the hotel is perfect. In between the track and downtown. Our room was great - like a little apartment. Thankfully hotel was in a decent neighborhood. No problems with room or staff - we will stay there again next year for the race!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Man some cooked something nasty.”
Reviews.Author: drwn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a Colts game. The rooms are huge. The appliances are new. The furnature is a little dated. The staff is superb. Someone cooked something and MAN did it ever stink in the hallway. It lingered all night. My family literally held our breath as we ran to our room. (Its not the hotel's fault) There is a pool. However, it is outside. The hotel does allow pets. I have a prejudice against that. But, hey, some would like that option. I just feel there is a time and a place for everything. A hotel is not the place for pets. Sorry, to all I have offended. Anyway, for the price, you cannot beat this hotel. Would I stay again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, if location is a bit "out of the loop"”
Reviews.Author: wouldbeworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights attending an event in Indianapolis and, overall, was very pleased with our stay. Friend had one room and I had another. Rooms are clean, well-appointed, and comfortable. I liked the bed immensely and slept very well all 4 nights at this hotel. Candlewood, being an extended stay chain, had the mini kitchen (though full size fridge) that would work very well for longer stays were you might not want to eat out every meal (though, for our purposes of visit, we didn't need a kitchen). Both rooms had a living room area and bedroom area with TV's in both. TV's slightly outdated but not terrible. Staff was mostly very pleasant and helpful. About the "worst", if you will, was one guy who wasn't gushy friendly, but never failed to attend to any questions we had. Also, once you started talking with this gentleman he really started opening up so I took it as just a person that is friendly but perhaps not overly extroverted. I didn't use the pool (which is outdoors) or exercise room, but checked it out on the off-chance I would be motivated to exercise on vacation. Room appeared to be clean and well-kept. Internet connection worked very well, other than having to sign on each time you turned the computer on...nothing major... Perhaps the only item to keep in mind is this property is clearly oriented to IUPUI hospital visitors - which it appears they do very well. You will definitely see many hospital visitors here and they hotel's shuttle even specifically has a wheelchair lift. It is also worthwhile to keep in mind if you are not staying here in connection to hospital visit this property is on the definite outer edge of downtown area. It's not an atrocious drive, probably 5-10 minutes, but if you need to be in the "thick of it all" this would not be your choice. Indeed, the property is located in a somewhat industrial/residential area with little around for the tourist. I might choose a more central downtown location next time in Indy, but for the property itself would have no problems staying again if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff & huge, clean suites”
Reviews.Author: LauraCrab
Reviews.Content: We could not be more pleased with our stay. The staff bent over backwards to help us with our every request. The suite was massive and spotless. Every useful or fun thing we could think of (food, dishes, DVDs, a nice pool) was available. We brought our dog, who proceeded to cause major problems because he was scared and sad. The staff was incredibly polite and helpful as we sorted out our options, but were also very mindful of their other guests who didn't appreciate his barking and crying. The hotel was both pet and human friendly, and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent quality, clean, nice size room, great employees”
Reviews.Author: trudi88
Reviews.Content: We were unfamiliar with the area and the employees were great at helping us. They also had a shuttle that took us to our event downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay for VAMC surgery”
Reviews.Author: Whitleywalker
Reviews.Content: Had to be in Indy for two nights due to my husband's surgery. Suite was very comfortable and clean. The price was excellent for the amount of space and the location - right across the river from the VAMC. You don't get housekeeping every day, but that was fine with me ~ just didn't know that ahead of time. I felt very safe the second night when I stayed alone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for IU Med Center”
Reviews.Author: flyingfish182
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week during my spouse's surgery and initial recovery. Only a mile and a half to IU Med Center's Barnhill entrance. With the Med Center's $5 for valet parking it was quick and economical, I didn't avail myself of their free shuttle. The suite was fabulous. Full kitchen, very room and very quiet for sleeping. Even two TV's with cable and Wifi! The staff was friendly and helpful. There is also a nice little pantry to purchase food items you may need. If you need a place for an extended stay while a loved one is a patient at IU Med Center, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility will return again.”
Reviews.Author: lbran
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Candlewood Suites City Centre about an hour ago. I had to stop and write this review before unpacking. I spent only one night there, 10-16-10, and wished I could have stayed longer. Both housekeeping and front desk were friendly , professional and helpful. My husband and I were pleased. You hear so many horror stories about hotels with dirty linen , rooms and rude staff. Not here. If all of the Candlewood hotels across the country are this good, then whenever we travel will definitely book at one. .Thanks again to the staff for making our visit comfortable and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “OVERPROMISED-UNDERDELIVERED”
Reviews.Author: rukiddingme99
Reviews.Content: We booked our two bedroom suite in February to arrive in July for a race weekend. We arrived early in the afternoon and were told that our room was being cleaned, so come back in an hour. When we got back, we were told we didn't have a room at all!!!! They wanted to send us two miles down the road to a 'sister' property and be given a ONE bedroom with two beds....FOR FOUR PEOPLE!!! Their excuse was that someone had to extend their stay so they kept the room we had reservations for, which is ludicrous...they should have moved those people and not inconvenienced us. When we pushed the issue, they ended up giving us two one bedrooms on site. We observed them doing the same thing to another group right behind us....had reservations, no room. Upon checkout, I asked why they did not have a room for a PREPAID reservation and the clerk just said..."you don't have a room until you get a room", so I said, "So a reservation doesn't mean anything here does it?" She agreed. Great way to do business Candlewood.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home from Doug.”
Reviews.Author: DLH1293920
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying at this Candlewood Suites, off and on, for the last 2 years. Due to my health situation, this is the best place to stay with its location and price. It is close to the Clarien Health hospitals, IU, Riley and also the VA hospital. They have a special rate for transplant patients. There is weekly housekeeping, a workout room, laundry room, outside pool, and coffee machine all at no cost. They also offer free shuttle service to hospitals and downtown Indy. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The floor plan is more like an apartment. The room is spacious and clean. Do yourself a favor and try them out.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: L1LB1T
Reviews.Content: Our room was larger and nicer than some apartments I have lived in!! The full kitchen made dining easy and convenient. The staff was very helpful and the business center was well laid out. It is a great place for business travelers or people staying in the area long term.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but some bumps that keep me from rating higher”
Reviews.Author: MotoGPMan
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean,spacious and seem quite new. The location is ok as far as somewhat close proximity to downtown and a few restaurants (not walking though) I reserved a 1-bed suite smoking room but when we arrived we were told only non-smoking rooms available even though out of curiosity I had gone to their website 1 day earlier to check at the cost of a simialr room at that time for a friend and the room came up as available. Actually it stated all rooms types were still available so couldn't quite figure out that one. Now I don't mind to have to go outside but I hate when you book a reservation and your room type is "suddenly unavailable" Now the lady who checked us in was quite nice and stated she would give us a 10% discount for our trouble so I was fine with that but then we go to check out and our room rate went from $111 a night to $159 with the 10% off???? It all was set right in the end but be sure to check your room bill before checking out. If they would have honored my reservation for a smoking room and also not messed with the bill I would give it 5 stars. I mean the whole part of the reservation process is to "Hold the Room" and the holding really is the most important part of the reservation process. I mean really "Anybody can just take 'em" The service was great the rooms clean, spacious and nice. More like an apartment then a hotel room. There is no breakfast served but the rooms have nice studio type kitchens with coffee maker, fridge, micro, dishwasher and 2 top burner. There is a small store in the lobby for basics accessible 24 hrs. Even though a few bumps on this stay I would stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great room!”
Reviews.Author: lotsobooks
Reviews.Content: There are 2 ways to visit IUPUI - stay in the city and enjoy city life or stay at Candlewood Suites and have a restful stay. I chose the latter and was pleasantly surprised! I had 2 rooms - one with a sofa and TV and one with a bed and TV - along with a kitchen and table. The rooms were spotless, the bed comfortable, and the microwave useful (for the free popcorn). I would recommend this place for anyone who has had enough of the city and enough travel to want a clean, nice place to stay without much noise, disruption, or hassle. No, they don't provide a free breakfast, but I was told that upon check-in plus I generally carry my own oatmeal anyway. The little store was a nice touch as I could get some soup and crackers for supper, so I didn't even have to go back out into the snow to get something to eat.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: KYAzura
Reviews.Content: It could not have been a more pleasant experience. The lobby and room were extremely clean so much so it looked brand new . It had such a clean smell. The furniture was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was very nice and helpful they even printed up the directions to a near by resturant for us. It was very close to the IU Hosptial for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Indy!”
Reviews.Author: aptbroker1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Jan 12 for one night. I was amazed! The one bedroom suites had full kitchen and a big flat screen TV in the living room and the bedroom. Comp coffee and popcorn. Everything was brand new and spotless. It's right on the White River near IUPUI and downtown Indy. There's a bar and mini grocery. Elevator and FREE washer and dryer. Excellent all the way around!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for a Great Room in Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: BestBetty
Reviews.Content: When I got to the downtown Indianapolis area, i could not believe that I didn't have to pay for parking! Unheard of! Free Parking! Wow! They had a Free Shuttle too! This shuttle took me back and forth to my business that I was visiting. The staff was great! Very friendly! And, I just loved the room! Very cute and pretty furniture! OMG! Loved it! It was very large and clean too! I know I will be staying here again when I come downtown. Shoot you cant beat the price! And no parking fees, no internet fees and a free shuttle! Wow! I couldnt believe it! I was in shock in a nice way, for once! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Candlewood Downtown”
Reviews.Author: AnnikaCarmel
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent choice for my family of 4. The kitchen was great. The room was very large. The outdoor pool was clean and big. I loved that we got free parking and free shuttle service to downtown Indianapolis! For the price, we got an excellent deal for being Downtown Indianpolis!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestGuy11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Candlewood Suites Indianapolis City Centre during a recent convention. I saved more than $50.00 per night when compared to other downtown hotels yet got a huge room with a kitchen. The living room was massive - sleeper/sofa, TV with DVD player. And the bedding was very comfortable. I had a room on the 9th floor with great views of the downtown skyline. I was told from the other side of the building you can see the Indianapolis Motor Speedway! While it's about 5 minutes from downtown, the shuttle service and free parking make up for the distance. The front desk was friendly and attentive. I could not have asked for a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, not great location”
Reviews.Author: dadpa
Reviews.Content: The Candlewood Suites is located in what was previously an apartment building so you are getting not just a room but a small apartment including kitchen, living room, and a hallway leading to a bedroom and bathroom. The living room included a sleep sofa. The hotel is intended for long-stays (workers staying in Indianapolis for extended periods) so they do not have daily maid service-towels and sheets are changed only once per week (and when you check out). The hotel has a small convenience store in the lobby with prices that are very reasonable. Outdoor pool only and a nice exercise room in the basement. Washers and dryers also available for laundry. Room was quiet and bed very comfortable. TV in both the bedroom and the living room. This would be a great place if you plan to use the hotel only for sleeping and want the convenience of kitchen facilities and a large room (or if you are planning an extended stay in Indianapolis). The hotel is located away from the downtown area and there is no where to walk - the front desk staff actually recommended that we not try to walk around the area after dark. You will need a car as there are no stores or restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, lousy service”
Reviews.Author: Carol0522
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Candlewood Suites for 1 week. The Suite was very nicely furnished and good size for our famiy of 4. The kitchen was well stocked. I was glad to find a broom in the closet so I could sweep up all the HAIRS in the bathroom. It appeared the maid had slopped a mop around but not bothered to actually clean the bathroom floor. We received NO maid service the entire week we were there. When you needed towels you were required to haul them down to the front desk and sometimes they had replacement towels and sometimes they didn't. You would finally receive the towels around 9 - 10 pm. The excuse given was that the girl doing towels was also the shuttle bus driver so she had no time. The pool was out of order for our entire stay with the exception of the morning we left. There was an obviously abandoned car or two in the parking lot with the trunk partly open and tires missing. The rooms were very nice but at the current level service I doubt they will remain that way. The price was for a nice hotel but the service level was not even close.

Reviews.Title: “One of Indy's Best Kept Secrets”
Reviews.Author: scouterrick
Reviews.Content: This was the 3d occasion for my bride and I to stay at this site for a trade show held downtown. Coming from the north after a 4+ hr drive this place of lodging has always been a real comfort to us . We booked on-line for $80/nt versus the "show discount rate" offered downtown of $135/nt. As requested our room was on the upper floor where it was peaceful. This hotel is only 5 yrs old but still looks brand new as many of it's rooms have been refurbished as well as the common areas. The rooms come with a full kitchen [micro only],Tv with VCR & DVD player plus a CD player (movies and music cd's are free from their library). Also available is a mini-C store, outdoor grill , fitness gym, indoor pool and a FREE laudramat. It's location is less than 15 min from city centre but nearby are 2 malls and at least 25 restaurants to choose from with-in a 3mi distance. Our personal favorite is Loon Lake Lodge which is a 1/4 mi drive for a 1,000 mi away dining experience. Go to their website for details--Loonlakelodge.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bedbugg
Reviews.Content: Got into this place at 1030pm after a long day on the road. We were greeted at the front entrance by Indy 500 hangers-on sitting on the curb with a case of Coronas, drinking it up in front of the property. It almost looked like we were pulling up to the front of a dorm building at Purdue. People were milling about and looked slightly out of place. This property has had a makeover and looked fresh and new inside. Our suite couldn't have been better. You will like your room. The location is not exactly in what I would call the "City Centre", but it is close. You will need a car or will have to call a cab to get to the city center. Although the place was clean, remodeled, and easy to get to, following the hotel website directions, it felt like we were in a whole different world coming and going. The front desk is almost set up like entering a dormatory. The girl at the front desk was friendly and checked us in just fine, but she seemed to be more interested in the Corona drinking young guy that was hitting on her than she was in explaining the details of the property to us. We stayed on the 10th floor and looking out the window at 3am there were people mlling about down in front front of the place. "Creepy" was the word my wife used to describe the outside atmosphere. Overall, if you can get over the oddity of the place outside, the construction still going on around the building itself and the oddballs hanging around the place, this is a great place to stay. No free breakfast, but if you are into cooking yourself, no problem here as you have all the goods to do that. You might even invite some of your new friends you meet outside at 3am to help cook breakfast and enjoy an omlet with you in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vbfamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel has just been completely remodeled. There was still some drywall dust in the hallway where light fixtures were installed. The only way to tell it is not a new building is the elevator was not new. There still must be some remodeling going on because during the day, Saturday included, they were using a jackhammer in the basement. We were six floors up right above the work and it was annoying. The rooms were great. The only thing missing from the full kitchen was an oven, it had everything else, including a dishwasher. They have both one and two bedrooms suites. The two bedroom suites were the size of an apartment and everything is new. Each bedroom had a TV along with the "living area". The beds were very comfortable. I will stay at this hotel the next time I am in Indy.

Reviews.Title: “won't go back”
Reviews.Author: luuluu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in Oct 05. I had never stayed at this chain before so I was curious about it. Extremely close to Interstate so highway noise definitely an issue. This place had the feel of a singles apartment complex and not in a good way. No breakfast. I will note that the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room itself was o.k., but nothing special. Definitely a budget feel to the establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stay!”
Reviews.Author: abgstat
Reviews.Content: Queen bed, recliner, table and chairs, and a small kitchen. The kitchen has a microwave, but not an oven (which I realized after a bought a frozen pizza!). Near the lobby, there's a small room with foods to purchase and a workout room. There is also a video library from which you can borrow from. Lots and lots of shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very clean, and nicely landscaped. Very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are comfortable and plenty of space. The high-speed internet access was easy and fast. They have a little sales center for stuff like milk and eggs and sodas. I was suprised to find that a soda there is only $.25 for a can instead of the normal $.60 I pay at work. All-in-all, so far, it's been a great place to stay. I'll definately go back if I'm in town again and I'll definately look for the chain elsewhere.

HotelInfo.Name: Candlewood Suites Indianapolis Dwtn Medical Dist
HotelInfo.Address: 1152 N White River Pkwy West Dr, Indianapolis, IN 46222 (Formerly Candlewood Suites Indianapolis City Centre)
